intro: Oenothera hookeri subsp. euhookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is part of the Onagraceae family, known for its diverse floral structures and ecological significance in desert ecosystems.
